byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

abstract: Islamic State militants seize historic Syrian city of Palmyra, marking yet another strategic victory for group five days after its capture of Ramadi in Iraq; city has particular value due to its rich gas resources and its location at crossroads of nation's central desert; many fear militants will destroy or damage Palmyra's rich trove of archeological sites and ancient art, as they have done in other cities.
lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants have already destroyed historical sites and sold off artifacts in other cities, and people fear they may do the same to the famous ruins in Palmyra.

headline.main: ISIS Fighters Seize Control of Syrian City of Palmyra, and Ancient Ruins
headline.print_headline: ISIS Seizes a City Pivotal in Syria and in History

snippet: Islamic State militants have already destroyed historical sites and sold off artifacts in other cities, and people fear they may do the same to the famous ruins in Palmyra.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
